thread.section_title: Arts and Entertainment coverage for all ages and interests - San Francisco Chronicle
thread.title: Ellen Page thankful to be part of gay rights story ‘Freeheld’
thread.title_full: Ellen Page thankful to be part of gay rights story ‘Freeheld’ - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Pam Grady
title: Ellen Page thankful to be part of gay rights story ‘Freeheld’
text:
Photo: Phil Caruso, Associated Press In “Freeheld,” Julianne Moore (left) is a terminally ill woman who fights for the right of her domestic partner, played by Ellen Page, to collect her pension. In “Freeheld,” Julianne Moore (left) is a terminally ill woman...
The timing of the world premiere of her new drama, “Freeheld,” at the Toronto International Film Festival is not lost on the film’s star and producer, Ellen Page. The gala screening at Roy Thomson Hall of the true story of a terminally ill New Jersey woman’s fight to assign her pension benefits to her female partner was happening mere months after gay marriage became legal in all 50 states and as Kentucky county clerk Kim Davis’ refusal to grant marriage licenses to same-sex couples was capturing headlines. In “Freeheld,” Julianne Moore (left) is a terminally ill woman who fights for the right of her domestic partner, played by Ellen Page, to collect her pension. In “Freeheld,” Julianne Moore (left) is a terminally ill woman...
The timing of the world premiere of her new drama, “Freeheld,” at the Toronto International Film Festival is not lost on the film’s star and producer, Ellen Page. The gala screening at Roy Thomson Hall of the true story of a terminally ill New Jersey woman’s fight to assign her pension benefits to her female partner was happening mere months after gay marriage became legal in all 50 states and as Kentucky county clerk Kim Davis’ refusal to grant marriage licenses to same-sex couples was capturing headlines.
